issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
These edits are not release critical and should be prioritized as such. Sorry for the lengthy feedback but figured this would be best handled as a batch update.

First sentence pg 5 not a sentence, needs a subject.

Setting Environmental Variables section pg 5:
 - no need to call them encrypted credentials in first sentence
 - second sentence call say access keys rather than keys
 - Remove clarification that we only need key authentication in some cases (sentences 3 and 4)
 
 
All commands:
remove --versbose option (it does not work)
 
Pg 7 
euca-add-group is deprecated and should reference the new command euca-create-group
 
Pg 8
euca-add-keypair should reference euca-create-keypair
 - Add notion of changing permissions of key pair file to 600 before use with the ssh command. 
 - chmod 600 keypair.pem 

Pg 11
euca-atach-volume
-  Not all device names are available for attachment, restricted values are /dev/sda and /dev/sdb

Pg 12
euca-authorize
- Additional syntax template: euca-authorize [-P {tcp,udp} [-p FROM_PORT-TO_PORT] | [-P icmp [-t TYPE:CODE]]] [-s CIDR | -o GROUP_NAME -u ACCOUNT_ID] GROUP_NAME
- additional examples
root@eucahost-51-74:~# euca-authorize -P tcp -p 22 mygroup
GROUP   mygroup
PERMISSION      mygroup ALLOWS  tcp     22      22      FROM    CIDR    0.0.0.0/0
root@eucahost-51-74:~#

root@eucahost-51-74:~# euca-authorize -P tcp -p 6697-7000 -s 1.2.3.0/24 mygroup
GROUP   mygroup
PERMISSION      mygroup ALLOWS  tcp     6697    7000    FROM    CIDR    1.2.3.0/24
root@eucahost-51-74:~#

root@eucahost-51-74:~#  euca-authorize -P icmp -t 0:0 -o othergroup -u 1234567890 mygroup
GROUP   mygroup
PERMISSION      mygroup ALLOWS  icmp    USER    1234567890      GRPNAME othergroup      FROM    CIDR    0.0.0.0/0
root@eucahost-51-74:~#

Pg 27
euca-describe-addresses:
- Do not document filters

Pg 53
euca-revoke:
- Same syntax and examples apply as euca-authorize from Pg 12 (noted above)

Pg 61
euca-version:
- example command now returns the version and code name:  "euca2ools 2.1.0 (Stencil)" rather than "euca2ools 2.0.0"

Pg 27
euare-accountuploadpolicy:
- Short option for --debug (namely "-D") is missing a leading hyphen

Pg 89
euare-useraddpolicy:
- For the:
 -o option:  IAM is not the policy's creator.  The tool is.
- Sample syntax:
euare-useraddpolicy -p POLICY_NAME -e {Allow,Deny} -u USER -a ACTION [-r RESOURCE]

Pg 86
euare-useraddcert example:

Pg 93
euare-userdel syntax:
euca-userdel -u user_name [-r]

Pg 98
euare-usergetinfo:
need to say that this is not part of the AWS IAM api

Pg 99
euare-usergetloginprofile 
If the have a profile it will show the username
If they do not have one it will not print the username

Page 106:
euare-usermod:
--enabled, --reg-status, and --pwd-expires are all eucalyptus specific options

comments.body: Closing out old resolved bug.  Feel free to re-open if this is still an issue.
